name: Holly's Chicken Cordon Bleu Casserole
author: Holly Fillmore Strong
summary: If you like Chicken Cordon Bleu, you will love this casserole! This is one of my family's favorites!
ingredients: 10  cooked skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into strips
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of chicken soup
directions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Mix the corn flake crumbs, Parmesan cheese, and 1/4 cup melted butter in a large bowl, then spread about 2/3 of the crumb mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking dish
Layer half the chicken breast strips over the crumb base, and sprinkle with salt and black pepper
Cover with half the Swiss cheese, then a layer of ham, followed by layers of mushrooms and green onions
Mix the cream of chicken soup and sour cream together in a bowl, and spread the mixture over the green onion layer
Place the rest of the chicken strips onto the soup layer, followed by the rest of the Swiss cheese
Top the casserole with the remaining 1/3 of the crumb mixture
Drizzle with 2 more tablespoons of melted butter if desired

Cover the casserole with aluminum foil, and bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes; remove the foil and bake until the casserole is bubbling, the cheese has melted, and the crumb topping is brown, an additional 15 minutes
